related_questions.question: What is solar energy physics?
related_questions.snippet: Solar energy is radiant light and heat from the Sun that is harnessed using a range of ever-evolving technologies such as solar heating, photovoltaics, solar thermal energy, solar architecture, molten salt power plants and artificial photosynthesis.
related_questions.title: Solar energy - Wikipedia

related_questions.question: What is solar energy in simple words?
related_questions.snippet: Solar cells can be used to generate electricity from sunlight. It is a device that converts light energy into electrical energy. Sometimes the term solar cell is reserved for devices intended specifically to capture energy from sunlight, while the term photovoltaic cell is used when the light source is unspecified.
related_questions.title: Solar energy - Simple English Wikipedia, the free encyclopedia

related_questions.question: What does solar energy mean in science?
related_questions.snippet: Solar energy, radiation from the Sun capable of producing heat, causing chemical reactions, or generating electricity. ... If suitably harnessed, this highly diffused source has the potential to satisfy all future energy needs.
related_questions.title: solar energy | Description, Uses, & Facts | Britannica.com

related_questions.question: What exactly is solar energy?
related_questions.snippet: Solar energy works by capturing the sun's energy and turning it into electricity for your home or business. Our sun is a natural nuclear reactor. It releases tiny packets of energy called photons, which travel the 93 million miles from the sun to Earth in about 8.5 minutes.
